sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词都有"热的"之意。
means: hot ： 最普通用词，指温度很高，往往有灼热、滚烫含义。
warm ： 通常指温度不太高，介于hot与cold之间，不太热也不太凉，给人以舒适感。
burning ： 暗示热源是火，多用于夸张，指像火烧一样热。

word_mean: 湿热气候，warm-wet climate  以降水丰沛、空气炎热为特征的气候。

sentence.Network_en: Poland provide the opposition for the Scots' last warm-up match at home.
sentence.Network_cn: 苏格兰队在国内最后一场热身赛的对手是波兰队。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English wearm (adjective), werman, wearmian (verb), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch and German warm, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin formus 'warm' and Greek thermos 'hot'

entry.def: Something that is warm has some heat but not enough to be hot.

example.ex: Wheat is grown in places which have cold winters and warm, dry summers...
example.tran: 小麦适宜在冬季寒冷而夏季温暖干燥的地方生长。

example.ex: Because it was warm, David wore only a white cotton shirt...
example.tran: 因为天气暖和，戴维只穿了一件白色的棉衬衣。

entry.def: Warm clothes and blankets are made of a material such as wool which protects you from the cold.

example.ex: They have been forced to sleep in the open without food or warm clothing...
example.tran: 他们被迫风餐露宿，吃不饱也穿不暖。

example.ex: The bed had clean sheets and warm blankets.
example.tran: 床上是干净的被单和暖和的毯子。

entry.def: Warm colours have red or yellow in them rather than blue or green, and make you feel comfortable and relaxed.

example.ex: We hope the colour gives the house a warm and inviting feel...
example.tran: 我们希望这种颜色能让房子给人一种暖意融融、宾至如归的感觉。

example.ex: The basement hallway is painted a warm yellow.
example.tran: 地下室的走廊漆成了暖黄色。

entry.def: A warm person is friendly and shows a lot of affection or enthusiasm in their behaviour.

example.ex: She was a warm and loving mother...
example.tran: 她是一位热情慈爱的母亲。

example.ex: 'Wonderful!' he exclaimed, in the familiar warm voice that made everybody who knew him feel welcome...
example.tran: “太棒了！”他欢呼道，他熟悉而热情的声音让所有认识他的人都感到如沐春风。

entry.def: If you warm a part of your body or if something hot warms it, it stops feeling cold and starts to feel hotter.

example.ex: The sun had come out to warm his back...
example.tran: 太阳出来了，把他后背晒得暖洋洋的。

example.ex: She went to warm her hands by the log fire.
example.tran: 她把手伸向木火堆取暖。

entry.tran: (对某人)产生好感;(对想法)开始感兴趣
entry.def: If you warm to a person or an idea, you become fonder of the person or more interested in the idea.

example.ex: Those who got to know him better warmed to his openness and honesty...
example.tran: 那些对他日渐了解的人被他的坦率和真诚所打动。

example.ex: Elizabeth warmed to her theme as the letter continued with her favourite lament.
example.tran: 随着这封信接下来进入到伊丽莎白最喜欢抱怨的内容，她开始奔向主题。

sentences.sentence: "The soup warmed slowly on the stove"

means.word_mean: 1. having or producing a comfortable and agreeable degree of heat or imparting or maintaining heat;
3. (color) inducing the impression of warmth; used especially of reds and oranges and yellows;
4. having or displaying warmth or affection;
8. characterized by liveliness or excitement or disagreement;
9. uncomfortable because of possible danger or trouble;
10. of a seeker; near to the object sought;

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Cook for a further minute, then keep warm.

Sentence.sentence: Some scientistsmaintain that the changes we are seeing fall within the range of random (无规律的) variation—some years are cold, others warm, and we have just had an unremarkable string of warm yearsrecently—but that is becoming an increasingly rare interpretation in the face of continued and increasing warm conditions.

Some scientistsmaintain that the changes we are seeing fall within the range of random (无规律的) variation—some years are cold, others warm, and we have just had an unremarkable string of warm yearsrecently—but that is becoming an increasingly rare interpretation in the face of continued and increasing warm conditions.
Global warming is a trend toward warmer conditions around the world.
The picture worsens with each round of El Nino, the unusually warm currents in the Pacific Ocean that drive up temperatures and invariably presage (预示) droughts and fires in the rain forest.
The unusual warm currents in the Pacific Ocean
carbon emissions are the leading cause of current global warming

sentences.en: She submerged her hands in warm water.
Red, yellow and orange are called warm colours.

means.word_mean: (使)变暖; 被加热; 暖和起来

sentences.en: The water is warming on the stove.

sentences.cn: 他的话使我的内心感到热乎乎的。

jushi.english: This statement met with warm reception from people all over the world.
jushi.chinese: 这一声明受到全世界人民的热烈欢迎。
